snippet: Mitt Romney is firmly in the lead there, but under the state Republican Party’s new rules, the winner no longer takes all.
abstract: New York Republican leaders are anticipating a competitive presidential primary race, because the state party has replaced its winner-take-all primary with a more complex system that could allow other candidates to pick up delegates, even if Mitt Romney wins the most votes, as expected.
lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney is firmly in the lead there, but under the state Republican Party’s new rules, the winner no longer takes all.

headline.seo: Delegates Up for Grabs in New York Primary
headline.main: Delegates Up for Grabs in Primary in New York
headline.print_headline: Delegates Up for Grabs In Primary in New York
